content.en: Ultrasound advancements: Scientists are exploring the use of algorithms to improve ultrasound imaging through the human skull for various medical applications. These algorithms, such as the phased-array transducer and MR-ARFI technique, can correct for aberrations and improve the accuracy of ultrasound imaging. Additionally, adaptive beamforming algorithms and full-wave simulation are being used to enhance transcranial ultrasound imaging for brain therapy and head injury diagnosis.
content.da: Ultralydsfremskridt: Forskere undersøger brugen af algoritmer til at forbedre ultralydsbilleddannelse gennem den menneskelige kranium til forskellige medicinske anvendelser. Disse algoritmer, såsom phased-array transducer og MR-ARFI-teknik, kan korrigere for aberrationer og forbedre nøjagtigheden af ultralydsbilleddannelse. Derudover anvendes adaptive beamforming algoritmer og fuldbølgesimulation til at forbedre transkraniel ultralydsbilleddannelse til hjerneterapi og diagnosticering af hovedskader.
